en.Slide 1: Let's see how we can reach a closed form of the summation $\displaystyle\sum_{i=0}^{\log{n}}2^i$
en.Slide 2: As an example suppose we have $n = 16$
en.Slide 3.1: When $i = 0$, this adds $1$ to the overall summation. This is represented by a single rectangle.
en.Slide 4.1: When $i = 1$, this adds $2$ to the overall summation. This is represented by two rectangles.
en.Slide 5.1: When $i = 2$, this adds $4$ to the overall summation. This is represented by Four rectangles.
en.Slide 6.1: When $i = 3$, this adds $8$ to the overall summation. This is represented by Eight rectangles.
en.Slide 7.1: When $i = 4$, this adds $16$ to the overall summation. This is represented by Sixteen rectangles.
en.Slide 8.1: The closed form solution of this summation can be found by calculating the total surface area of the resulted shape.
en.Slide 12: Now it is very easy to calculate the surface area of this shape which is $2n - 1$
